comments:
Eclipse 3.0 crashes after splash screen and writes an error log to be added at 
the end of this massage
It didnt happend to me in any other version I tryed (3.0 Rc2 and RC3)
Hope the problem will be fix
thanks in advance
Matan Drori a new Eclipse user

Are you sure that you downloaded the Eclipse SDK and not the Eclipse RCP
Framework? The RCP framework does not include an application and you will get
this message when trying to run it.

yes i download 3.0 relese SDK from this link
ftp://download2.eclipse.org/R-3.0-200406251208/eclipse-SDK-3.0-win32.zip

now im back working with 3.0 RC3 until the bug will be fixed...
cause 3.0RC3 works good for me

Did you install the new version over-top of the old one or did you delete the
old one first (or install the new one to a new directory)?

i put it over the RC3 why?
sould it make a diffarnce?

Yes, this is usually the cause of many problems.
Please install eclipse in a new folder and then start.
Let us know if this fixed the problem.

This is the first time that installing a new build over an existing install has
ever caused a problem for me.  Going forward, this is a difficult requirement to
swallow.  I have many projects that I'd rather not need to configure/import
every time a new Eclipse build comes out.

This has always been the case since day 1. Many newsgroup post say that.

Installing eclipse in a new folder does not mean recreating a new workspace.
If you don't want to loose your workspace, on startup specify a location 
outside of your eclipse install (using the chooser) and then you can change 
eclipse as many times as you want. This is typically the way we work around 
here.

You can also specify -data <yourWorkspace>.

As Pascal mentions, it has always been a requirement that you need to uninstall
previous releases or install a new release to a new directory.

Please refer to the README file in your install for more information.

/eclipse/readme/readme_eclipse.html#Upgrading
*** Bug 69500 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 69123 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
